model.lever.lever__requisition_enhanced.name: lever__requisition_enhanced

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the source of the record when unioning functionality is applied. This field will be empty if unioning is not used.

is_backfill.name: is_backfill
is_backfill.description: Boolean that is true if the requisition represents a backfill or new headcount.  If unspecified, defaults to false.

compensation_band_currency.name: compensation_band_currency
compensation_band_currency.description: The ISO currency code associated with the requisition's compensation band.

compensation_band_interval.name: compensation_band_interval
compensation_band_interval.description: The string representing the interval of payment for the compensation band.

compensation_band_max.name: compensation_band_max
compensation_band_max.description: The high bound for the compensation band.

compensation_band_min.name: compensation_band_min
compensation_band_min.description: The low bound for the compensation band.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the requisition was first created.

creator_user_id.name: creator_user_id
creator_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who created the requisition.

employment_status.name: employment_status
employment_status.description: The work type of the requisition ('full-time', 'part-time', 'intern', 'contractor', or 'temp-worker').

headcount_hired.name: headcount_hired
headcount_hired.description: The number of filled seats / openings on the requisition, or the string, 'unlimited'.

headcount_infinite.name: headcount_infinite
headcount_infinite.description: Indicates if the headcount for the job requisition is unlimited, allowing for an unrestricted number of hires.

headcount_total_allotted.name: headcount_total_allotted
headcount_total_allotted.description: Total headcount allotted for this requisition.

hiring_manager_user_id.name: hiring_manager_user_id
hiring_manager_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who is the hiring manager for this requisition.

internal_notes.name: internal_notes
internal_notes.description: Free form text for notes and meta-data about the requisition, visible to anyone who can see the requisition in Lever.

job_location.name: job_location
job_location.description: The location associated with the requisition.

job_title.name: job_title
job_title.description: The human-readable name for the requisition.

owner_user_id.name: owner_user_id
owner_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who owns the requisition.

status.name: status
status.description: The status of the requisition. Can be 'open', 'onHold', 'closed', or 'draft'.

job_team.name: job_team
job_team.description: The team associated with the requisition

creator_name.name: creator_name
creator_name.description: Full name of the user who created the requisition.

requisition_owner_name.name: requisition_owner_name
requisition_owner_name.description: Full user name of the user who owns the requisition.

hiring_manager_name.name: hiring_manager_name
hiring_manager_name.description: Full user name of the requisition's hiring manager.

count_postings.name: count_postings
count_postings.description: Number of postings associated with this requisition.

has_posting.name: has_posting
has_posting.description: Boolean that is true if the requisition has a posting.

count_offers.name: count_offers
count_offers.description: Total count of extended offers associated with this requisition. Note - includes offers regardless of their status.

has_offer.name: has_offer
has_offer.description: Boolean that is true if the requisition has any offer associated with it.

model.lever.lever__requisition_enhanced.raw_code:
{{ config(enabled=var('lever_using_requisitions', True)) }}

with requisition_users as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('int_lever__requisition_users') }}
),

requisition_posting as (

    select 
        source_relation,
        requisition_id,
        count(posting_id) as count_postings
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__requisition_posting') }}

    group by 1,2
),

requisition_offer as (

    select
        source_relation,
        requisition_id,
        count(offer_id) as count_offers
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__requisition_offer') }}

    group by 1,2
),

final as (

    select 
        requisition_users.*,
        coalesce(requisition_posting.count_postings, 0) as count_postings,
        requisition_posting.requisition_id is not null as has_posting,

        coalesce(requisition_offer.count_offers, 0) as count_offers,
        requisition_offer.requisition_id is not null as has_offer

    from requisition_users
    left join requisition_posting 
        on requisition_users.requisition_id = requisition_posting.requisition_id
        and requisition_users.source_relation = requisition_posting.source_relation
    left join requisition_offer
        on requisition_users.requisition_id = requisition_offer.requisition_id
        and requisition_users.source_relation = requisition_offer.source_relation
)

select * from final

        on requisition.hiring_manager_user_id = hiring_manager.user_id

    left join lever_user as requisition_owner
        on requisition.owner_user_id = requisition_owner.user_id

model.lever.lever__interview_enhanced.name: lever__interview_enhanced
model.lever.lever__interview_enhanced.description: Table in which each row is a unique interview-feedback combo. Interviews without feedback appear here as well.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the source of the record when unioning functionality is applied. This field will be empty if unioning is not used.

canceled_at.name: canceled_at
canceled_at.description: Timestamp of when the interview was canceled.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the interview was created.

creator_user_id.name: creator_user_id
creator_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who created the interview in lever.

occurred_at.name: occurred_at
occurred_at.description: Date + time at which the interview was set to occur.

duration_minutes.name: duration_minutes
duration_minutes.description: Interview duration in minutes, minimum value is 1.

feedback_reminder_frequency.name: feedback_reminder_frequency
feedback_reminder_frequency.description: Frequency of feedback reminders (i.e. once, daily, frequently, none). Defaults to 'frequently' which is every 6 hours.

location.name: location
location.description: Interview location. Usually the name of a booked conference room but can also be a  phone number to call.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Foreign key referencing the OPPORTUNITY being interviewed for.

panel_id.name: panel_id
panel_id.description: Unique id of the PANEL this interview belongs to.

opportunity_stage_id.name: opportunity_stage_id
opportunity_stage_id.description: Foreign key referencing the STAGE that the candidate was in at the time  the interview was scheduled.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.description: Name of timezone in which interview was scheduled to occur.

feedback_form_id.name: feedback_form_id
feedback_form_id.description: Unique id of the feedback form.

feedback_completer_user_id.name: feedback_completer_user_id
feedback_completer_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who completed the feedback.

feedback_completed_at.name: feedback_completed_at
feedback_completed_at.description: Timestamp of when the feedback form was completed.

feedback_form_instructions.name: feedback_form_instructions
feedback_form_instructions.description: Guidelines given for how give a feedback score.

score_system_value.name: score_system_value
score_system_value.description: Overall rating (1-4 scale) to the candidate.

feedback_form_title.name: feedback_form_title
feedback_form_title.description: Form title. This can be edited in Feedback and Form Settings.

interviewer_user_id.name: interviewer_user_id
interviewer_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER that interviewed the candidate.

feedback_completer_name.name: feedback_completer_name
feedback_completer_name.description: Full name of the user who completed the feedback form.

interview_coordinator_name.name: interview_coordinator_name
interview_coordinator_name.description: Full name of the user who created the interviewer in Lever.

ended_at.name: ended_at
ended_at.description: Timestamp of when the interview was scheduled to end.

opportunity_owner_name.name: opportunity_owner_name
opportunity_owner_name.description: Full name of the user who owns the opportunity in Lever.

referrer_name.name: referrer_name
referrer_name.description: Full name of the user who referred the candidate for this opportunity.

hiring_manager_name.name: hiring_manager_name
hiring_manager_name.description: Full name of the hiring manager of role for which the opportunity applied.

interviewer_is_hiring_manager.name: interviewer_is_hiring_manager
interviewer_is_hiring_manager.description: Boolean that is true if the interviewer is also the hiring manager of this position.

interviewee_name.name: interviewee_name
interviewee_name.description: Full name of the interviewee candidate.

interviewee_origin.name: interviewee_origin
interviewee_origin.description: The way in which the interviewed opportunity was added to lever. Includes 'agency', 'applied', 'internal', 'referred', 'sourced', and 'university'.

days_between_opp_created_and_interview.name: days_between_opp_created_and_interview
days_between_opp_created_and_interview.description: Number of days that have passed between the creation of this opportunity and the beginning of this interview.

has_advanced_since_interview.name: has_advanced_since_interview
has_advanced_since_interview.description: Boolean that is true if the opportunity advanced to another stage after this interview ended.

model.lever.lever__interview_enhanced.raw_code:
-- note: each record is a unique interview-interviewer feedback form combo
-- an interview can have multiple interviewers, and interviewers can have multiple feedback forms
with interview as (

    select 
        *,
        cast( {{ dbt.dateadd(datepart='minute', interval='duration_minutes', from_date_or_timestamp='occurred_at') }}
            as {{ dbt.type_timestamp() }} ) as ended_at
    from {{ ref('int_lever__interview_users') }}
),

--  just to grab stufff
opportunity as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('int_lever__opportunity_users') }}
),

join_w_opportunity as (

    select
        interview.*,
        opportunity.opportunity_owner_name,
        opportunity.referrer_name,
        opportunity.hiring_manager_name,
        coalesce(lower(interview.inteviewer_name) = lower(opportunity.hiring_manager_name), false) as interviewer_is_hiring_manager,
        opportunity.contact_name as interviewee_name,
        opportunity.contact_location as interviewee_location,
        opportunity.origin as interviewee_origin,
        opportunity.contact_id as interviewee_contact_id,
        {{ dbt.datediff('opportunity.created_at', 'interview.occurred_at', 'day') }} as days_between_opp_created_and_interview,
        opportunity.last_advanced_at > interview.ended_at as has_advanced_since_interview

    from interview
    join opportunity 
        on opportunity.opportunity_id = interview.opportunity_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = interview.source_relation
)

select * from join_w_opportunity

-- note: each record is a unique interview-interviewer feedback form combo
-- an interview can have multiple interviewers, and interviewers can have multiple feedback forms
with  __dbt__cte__int_lever__interview_feedback as (
with interview as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__interview"

),

-- join with this to limit noise 
interview_feedback as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__interview_feedback"
),

feedback_form as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__feedback_form"

    where deleted_at is null
),

join_w_feedback as (

    select
        interview.*,
        feedback_form.feedback_form_id,
        feedback_form.creator_user_id as feedback_completer_user_id,
        feedback_form.completed_at as feedback_completed_at,

        feedback_form.instructions as feedback_form_instructions,
        feedback_form.score_system_value,
        feedback_form.form_title as feedback_form_title


    from interview
    left join interview_feedback 
        on interview.interview_id = interview_feedback.interview_id
        and interview.source_relation = interview_feedback.source_relation
    left join feedback_form 
        on interview_feedback.feedback_form_id = feedback_form.feedback_form_id
        and interview_feedback.source_relation = feedback_form.source_relation
)

select *
from join_w_feedback
),  __dbt__cte__int_lever__interview_users as (
with interview_feedback as (
    select *
    from __dbt__cte__int_lever__interview_feedback
),

lever_user as (
    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__user"
),

interviewer_user as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__interviewer_user"
),

-- there can be multiple interviewers for one interview
grab_interviewers as (

    select
        interview_feedback.*,
        interviewer_user.user_id as interviewer_user_id
    from interview_feedback
    left join interviewer_user 
        on interview_feedback.interview_id = interviewer_user.interview_id
        and interview_feedback.feedback_completer_user_id = interviewer_user.user_id
        and interview_feedback.source_relation = interviewer_user.source_relation

),

-- necessary users are 
-- interviewer, completer of feedback, recruiter coordinator , hiring manager
grab_user_names as (

    select

        interviewer.full_name as inteviewer_name,
        interviewer.email as interviewer_email,
        feedback_completer.full_name as feedback_completer_name,
        interview_coordinator.full_name as interview_coordinator_name

    from 
    grab_interviewers
    left join lever_user as interviewer 
        on grab_interviewers.interviewer_user_id = interviewer.user_id
        and interviewer.source_relation = grab_interviewers.source_relation

    left join lever_user as feedback_completer
        on grab_interviewers.feedback_completer_user_id = feedback_completer.user_id
        and feedback_completer.source_relation = grab_interviewers.source_relation

    left join lever_user as interview_coordinator
        on grab_interviewers.creator_user_id = interview_coordinator.user_id
        and interview_coordinator.source_relation = grab_interviewers.source_relation

)

-- unique row for every interview-interviewer-feedback combo
select * from grab_user_names

with lever_user as (

opportunity_application as (

),

grab_user_names as (

    select
        opportunity_application.*,
        opportunity_owner.full_name as opportunity_owner_name,
        referrer.full_name as referrer_name,
        hiring_manager.full_name as hiring_manager_name

    from opportunity_application

    left join lever_user as opportunity_owner
        on opportunity_application.owner_user_id = opportunity_owner.user_id
        and opportunity_owner.source_relation = opportunity_application.source_relation
    left join lever_user as referrer
        on opportunity_application.referrer_user_id = referrer.user_id
        and referrer.source_relation = opportunity_application.source_relation
    left join lever_user as hiring_manager
        on opportunity_application.posting_hiring_manager_user_id = hiring_manager.user_id
        and hiring_manager.source_relation = opportunity_application.source_relation
)

select * from grab_user_names
), interview as (

    select 
        *,
        cast( 

    occurred_at + ((interval '1 minute') * (duration_minutes))


            as timestamp ) as ended_at
    from __dbt__cte__int_lever__interview_users
),

--  just to grab stufff
opportunity as (

    select *
    from __dbt__cte__int_lever__opportunity_users
),

join_w_opportunity as (

    select
        interview.*,
        opportunity.opportunity_owner_name,
        opportunity.referrer_name,
        opportunity.hiring_manager_name,
        coalesce(lower(interview.inteviewer_name) = lower(opportunity.hiring_manager_name), false) as interviewer_is_hiring_manager,
        opportunity.contact_name as interviewee_name,
        opportunity.contact_location as interviewee_location,
        opportunity.origin as interviewee_origin,
        opportunity.contact_id as interviewee_contact_id,
        
        ((interview.occurred_at)::date - (opportunity.created_at)::date)
     as days_between_opp_created_and_interview,
        opportunity.last_advanced_at > interview.ended_at as has_advanced_since_interview

    from interview
    join opportunity 
        on opportunity.opportunity_id = interview.opportunity_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = interview.source_relation
)

select * from join_w_opportunity

model.lever.lever__opportunity_enhanced.name: lever__opportunity_enhanced

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the source of the record when unioning functionality is applied. This field will be empty if unioning is not used.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Unique ID of the opportunity.

archived_at.name: archived_at
archived_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was archived.

archived_reason_id.name: archived_reason_id
archived_reason_id.description: Foreign key referencing the ARCHIVE_REASON for which the opportunity was archived.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.description: Foreign key referencing the CONTACT info of the candidate applying in this opportunity.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was created (ie when the candidate clicked "apply" on your company website).

is_data_protection_contact_allowed.name: is_data_protection_contact_allowed
is_data_protection_contact_allowed.description: Boolean that is true if relevant data policy regulations allow for contacting  this opportunity's candidate.

data_protection_contact_expires_at.name: data_protection_contact_expires_at
data_protection_contact_expires_at.description: Timestamp of when this permission/data policy expires.

is_data_protection_store_allowed.name: is_data_protection_store_allowed
is_data_protection_store_allowed.description: Boolean that is true if relevant data policy regulations allow for storing  this opportunity record.

data_protection_store_expires_at.name: data_protection_store_expires_at
data_protection_store_expires_at.description: Timestamp of when this permission/data policy expires.

contact_headline.name: contact_headline
contact_headline.description: Contact headline, typically a list of previous companies where the contact has worked or  schools that the contact has attended.

is_anonymized.name: is_anonymized
is_anonymized.description: Boolean that is true if the opportunity has been anonymized (therefore fully anonymizing  the contact and removing their *personal* information).

last_advanced_at.name: last_advanced_at
last_advanced_at.description: Timestamp of when the candidate advanced to their current stage in the hiring pipeline.

last_interaction_at.name: last_interaction_at
last_interaction_at.description: Timestamp of when the Opportunity profile was last interacted with. See interactions [here](https://help.lever.co/hc/en-us/articles/205697619).

contact_location.name: contact_location
contact_location.description: Current contact location of the candidate.

origin.name: origin
origin.description: The way in which the opportunity was added to lever. Includes 'agency', 'applied', 'internal', 'referred', 'sourced', and 'university'.

owner_user_id.name: owner_user_id
owner_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who owns this opportunity.

snoozed_until.name: snoozed_until
snoozed_until.description: Timestamp of when the current snooze period of this opportunity ends (if snoozed).

stage_id.name: stage_id
stage_id.description: Foreign key referencing the ID of the current stage of the opportunity.

updated_at.name: updated_at
updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was last updated in lever.

comments.name: comments
comments.description: Any additional comments from the candidate included in the job application.

company.name: company
company.description: The candidate's current company or organization.

posting_hiring_manager_user_id.name: posting_hiring_manager_user_id
posting_hiring_manager_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who is the job posting's hiring manager, at the time  the application was submitted.

posting_id.name: posting_id
posting_id.description: Foreign key referencing the job POSTING for which the candidate applied.

posting_owner_user_id.name: posting_owner_user_id
posting_owner_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who owns this posting at the time the candidate applied.

referrer_user_id.name: referrer_user_id
referrer_user_id.description: The user ID of the candidate's referrer.

requisition_id.name: requisition_id
requisition_id.description: If the application was archived as hired against a requisition, a foreign key referencing the id of the REQUISITION against which the application was hired.

application_type.name: application_type
application_type.description: Type of the application. An application can be of type referral, user, or posting. Applications of type  referral are created when a user refers a candidate for a job posting. Applications have type user when they  are applied manually to a posting in Lever. Applications have type posting when a candidate applies to a job  posting through your company's jobs page.

opportunity_owner_name.name: opportunity_owner_name
opportunity_owner_name.description: Full name of the user who owns the opportunity in Lever.

referrer_name.name: referrer_name
referrer_name.description: Full name of the user who referred the candidate for this opportunity.

hiring_manager_name.name: hiring_manager_name
hiring_manager_name.description: Full name of the hiring manager of role for which the opportunity applied.

sources.name: sources
sources.description: Aggregated list of the channels through which this opportunity was sourced.

emails.name: emails
emails.description: Aggregated list of email addresses associated with this contact.

phones.name: phones
phones.description: Aggregated list of the contact's phone numbers (with phone types).

linkedin_link.name: linkedin_link
linkedin_link.description: Contact URL that contains 'linkedin.com' in it.

github_link.name: github_link
github_link.description: Contact URL that contains 'github.com' in it.

current_stage.name: current_stage
current_stage.description: The stage that the opportunity is currently at in the pipeline.

tags.name: tags
tags.description: Aggregated coma-separated list of the tags associated with this opportunity.

archive_reason.name: archive_reason
archive_reason.description: Reason given for archiving this opportunity.

job_title.name: job_title
job_title.description: Title of the job posting role.Title of the job posting role.

job_commitment.name: job_commitment
job_commitment.description: Tag for job position work type (e.g. Full-time, Part-time, Internship).

job_department.name: job_department
job_department.description: Tag for the department to which the job posting's team belongs, if present.

job_level.name: job_level
job_level.description: Tag for job posting level (e.g. Senior, Junior). Note - this has been deprecated by Lever  but is currently maintained for backward compatibility.

job_team.name: job_team
job_team.description: Tag for the team to which the job posting belongs (a sub-category of department).

current_state_of_job_posting.name: current_state_of_job_posting
current_state_of_job_posting.description: Current status of the posting, which may include 'published', 'internal' (called 'unlisted' in the UI), 'closed', 'draft', 'pending' (awaiting approval), and 'rejected'.

opp_created_n_days_after_first_app.name: opp_created_n_days_after_first_app
opp_created_n_days_after_first_app.description: How many days this opportunity was created after the first application was sent to this posting.

has_offer.name: has_offer
has_offer.description: Boolean that is true if the opportunity has been extended an offer.

current_offer_status.name: current_offer_status
current_offer_status.description: A string describing the current status of the offer. Can include:  draft - the offer is still under construction approval-sent - the offer needs approval approved - the offer has been approved sent - the offer has been sent through Lever sent-manually - the offer has been sent to the candidate outside of Lever opened - the candidate has opened the offer denied - the candidate denied the offer signed - the candidate signed the offer

count_interviews.name: count_interviews
count_interviews.description: The number of interviews that have been scheduled for this opportunity.

count_interviewers.name: count_interviewers
count_interviewers.description: Count of how many internal users the opportunity has spoken to via interview.

latest_interview_scheduled_at.name: latest_interview_scheduled_at
latest_interview_scheduled_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity's most recent (or perhaps future) interview was scheduled for.

has_interviewed_w_hiring_manager.name: has_interviewed_w_hiring_manager
has_interviewed_w_hiring_manager.description: Boolean that is true if the opportunity has interviewed with the hiring manager.

model.lever.lever__opportunity_enhanced.raw_code:
with opportunity as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('int_lever__opportunity_contact_info') }}
),

stage as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__stage') }}
),

archive_reason as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__archive_reason') }}
),

opportunity_tags as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('int_lever__opportunity_tags') }}
),

-- gotta do this in case an opportunity has been sent multiple offer versions
order_offers as (

    select 
        *,
        row_number() over(
            partition by opportunity_id {{ ', source_relation' if var('lever_union_schemas', false) or var('lever_union_databases', false) }}
            order by created_at desc) as row_num 
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__offer') }}
),

last_offer as (

    select *
    from order_offers 
    where row_num = 1
),

-- to grab info about the job
posting as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('lever__posting_enhanced') }}
),

-- to produce some interview metrics 
interview_metrics as (

    select
        source_relation,
        opportunity_id,
        count(distinct interview_id) as count_interviews,
        count(distinct interviewer_user_id) as count_interviewers, 
        max(occurred_at) as latest_interview_scheduled_at,
        max(case when interviewer_is_hiring_manager then 1 else 0 end) as has_interviewed_w_hiring_manager

    from {{ ref('lever__interview_enhanced') }}

    group by 1,2
),

final as (

    select 
        opportunity.*,

        stage.stage_name as current_stage,
        opportunity_tags.tags, 
        archive_reason.archive_reason_title as archive_reason,

        posting.job_title,
        posting.job_commitment,
        posting.job_department,
        posting.job_level,
        posting.job_location,
        posting.job_team,
        posting.current_state as current_state_of_job_posting,
        -- time from first application for this posting
        {{ dbt.datediff('posting.first_app_sent_at', 'opportunity.created_at', 'day') }} as opp_created_n_days_after_first_app,

        last_offer.opportunity_id is not null as has_offer,
        last_offer.status as current_offer_status,

        coalesce(interview_metrics.count_interviews, 0) as count_interviews,
        coalesce(interview_metrics.count_interviewers, 0) as count_interviewers,
        interview_metrics.latest_interview_scheduled_at,
        case when coalesce(interview_metrics.has_interviewed_w_hiring_manager, 0) = 0 then false else true end as has_interviewed_w_hiring_manager

    from opportunity
    join stage  
        on opportunity.stage_id = stage.stage_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = stage.source_relation
    left join archive_reason
        on opportunity.archived_reason_id = archive_reason.archive_reason_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = archive_reason.source_relation
    left join opportunity_tags
        on opportunity.opportunity_id = opportunity_tags.opportunity_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = opportunity_tags.source_relation
    left join last_offer
        on opportunity.opportunity_id = last_offer.opportunity_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = last_offer.source_relation
    left join posting
        on opportunity.posting_id = posting.posting_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = posting.source_relation
    left join interview_metrics 
        on opportunity.opportunity_id = interview_metrics.opportunity_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = interview_metrics.source_relation
)

select * from final
model.lever.lever__opportunity_enhanced.compiled_code:
with  __dbt__cte__int_lever__opportunity_application as (
with opportunity as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__opportunity"
),

application as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__application"
),

final as (

    select 
        opportunity.*,
        application.application_id,
        application.comments,
        application.company, 
        application.posting_hiring_manager_user_id,
        application.posting_id,
        application.posting_owner_user_id,
        application.referrer_user_id,
        application.requisition_id,
        application.type as application_type

    from opportunity
    left join application
        on opportunity.opportunity_id = application.opportunity_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = application.source_relation
)

select *
from final
),  __dbt__cte__int_lever__opportunity_users as (
with lever_user as (
    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__user"
),

opportunity_application as (
    
    select *
    from __dbt__cte__int_lever__opportunity_application
),

-- necessary users = opp owner, referrer, hiring manager
grab_user_names as (

    select
        opportunity_application.*,
        opportunity_owner.full_name as opportunity_owner_name,
        referrer.full_name as referrer_name,
        hiring_manager.full_name as hiring_manager_name

    from opportunity_application

    left join lever_user as opportunity_owner
        on opportunity_application.owner_user_id = opportunity_owner.user_id
        and opportunity_owner.source_relation = opportunity_application.source_relation
    left join lever_user as referrer
        on opportunity_application.referrer_user_id = referrer.user_id
        and referrer.source_relation = opportunity_application.source_relation
    left join lever_user as hiring_manager
        on opportunity_application.posting_hiring_manager_user_id = hiring_manager.user_id
        and hiring_manager.source_relation = opportunity_application.source_relation
)

select * from grab_user_names
),  __dbt__cte__int_lever__contact_info as (
with contact_phones as (

    select
        source_relation,
        contact_id,
        
    string_agg(phone_type || ': ' || phone_number, ', ')

 as phones

    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__contact_phone"

    group by 1,2
),

contact_emails as (

    select
        source_relation,
        contact_id,
        
    string_agg('<' || email || '>', ', ')

 as emails

    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__contact_email"

    group by 1,2
),

contact_links as (

    select 
        source_relation,
        contact_id,

        -- ideally, people only have one of each type of these links. 
        -- taking the max as that will produce a more constant result than ordering via row_number() window
        -- function ordering by _fivetran_synced

        max(case when lower(link) like '%linkedin.com%' then link end) as linkedin_link,
        max(case when lower(link) like '%github.com%' then link end) as github_link
    
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__contact_link"
    group by 1,2
),

final as (

    select 
        contact_emails.*,
        contact_phones.phones,
        contact_links.linkedin_link,
        contact_links.github_link

    from contact_emails 
    left join contact_phones 
        on contact_emails.contact_id = contact_phones.contact_id
        and contact_emails.source_relation = contact_phones.source_relation
    left join contact_links 
        on contact_emails.contact_id = contact_links.contact_id
        and contact_emails.source_relation = contact_links.source_relation
)

select * from final
),  __dbt__cte__int_lever__opportunity_contact_info as (
with opportunity as (

    -- this builds off the source opportunity table, incorporating application and internal user data. 
    select *
    from __dbt__cte__int_lever__opportunity_users
),

opportunity_sources as (

    select
        source_relation,
        opportunity_id,
        
    string_agg(source, ', ')

 as sources

    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__opportunity_source"

    group by 1,2
),

contact_info as (

    select *
    from __dbt__cte__int_lever__contact_info
),

order_resumes as (

    select 
        *,
        row_number() over(
            partition by opportunity_id  
            order by created_at desc) as row_num
    
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__resume"
),

latest_resume as (

    select *
    from order_resumes 

    where row_num = 1
),

final as (

    select
        opportunity.*,
        opportunity_sources.sources,
        latest_resume.file_download_url as resume_download_url,
        contact_info.phones,
        contact_info.emails,
        contact_info.linkedin_link,
        contact_info.github_link

    from opportunity

    left join opportunity_sources
        on opportunity.opportunity_id = opportunity_sources.opportunity_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = opportunity_sources.source_relation

    left join latest_resume 
        on latest_resume.opportunity_id = opportunity.opportunity_id
        and latest_resume.source_relation = opportunity.source_relation

    left join contact_info
        on contact_info.contact_id = opportunity.contact_id
        and contact_info.source_relation = opportunity.source_relation
)

select *
from final
),  __dbt__cte__int_lever__opportunity_tags as (
with opportunity_tag as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__opportunity_tag"
),

agg_tags as (

    select
        source_relation,
        opportunity_id,
        
    string_agg(tag_name, ', ')

 as tags 

    from opportunity_tag
    group by 1,2
)

select * from agg_tags
), opportunity as (

    select *
    from __dbt__cte__int_lever__opportunity_contact_info
),

stage as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__stage"
),

archive_reason as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__archive_reason"
),

opportunity_tags as (

    select *
    from __dbt__cte__int_lever__opportunity_tags
),

-- gotta do this in case an opportunity has been sent multiple offer versions
order_offers as (

    select 
        *,
        row_number() over(
            partition by opportunity_id 
            order by created_at desc) as row_num 
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__offer"
),

last_offer as (

    select *
    from order_offers 
    where row_num = 1
),

-- to grab info about the job
posting as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."lever__posting_enhanced"
),

-- to produce some interview metrics 
interview_metrics as (

    select
        source_relation,
        opportunity_id,
        count(distinct interview_id) as count_interviews,
        count(distinct interviewer_user_id) as count_interviewers, 
        max(occurred_at) as latest_interview_scheduled_at,
        max(case when interviewer_is_hiring_manager then 1 else 0 end) as has_interviewed_w_hiring_manager

    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."lever__interview_enhanced"

    group by 1,2
),

final as (

    select 
        opportunity.*,

        stage.stage_name as current_stage,
        opportunity_tags.tags, 
        archive_reason.archive_reason_title as archive_reason,

        posting.job_title,
        posting.job_commitment,
        posting.job_department,
        posting.job_level,
        posting.job_location,
        posting.job_team,
        posting.current_state as current_state_of_job_posting,
        -- time from first application for this posting
        
        ((opportunity.created_at)::date - (posting.first_app_sent_at)::date)
     as opp_created_n_days_after_first_app,

        last_offer.opportunity_id is not null as has_offer,
        last_offer.status as current_offer_status,

        coalesce(interview_metrics.count_interviews, 0) as count_interviews,
        coalesce(interview_metrics.count_interviewers, 0) as count_interviewers,
        interview_metrics.latest_interview_scheduled_at,
        case when coalesce(interview_metrics.has_interviewed_w_hiring_manager, 0) = 0 then false else true end as has_interviewed_w_hiring_manager

    from opportunity
    join stage  
        on opportunity.stage_id = stage.stage_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = stage.source_relation
    left join archive_reason
        on opportunity.archived_reason_id = archive_reason.archive_reason_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = archive_reason.source_relation
    left join opportunity_tags
        on opportunity.opportunity_id = opportunity_tags.opportunity_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = opportunity_tags.source_relation
    left join last_offer
        on opportunity.opportunity_id = last_offer.opportunity_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = last_offer.source_relation
    left join posting
        on opportunity.posting_id = posting.posting_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = posting.source_relation
    left join interview_metrics 
        on opportunity.opportunity_id = interview_metrics.opportunity_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = interview_metrics.source_relation
)

select * from final

model.lever.lever__posting_enhanced.compiled_code:
with  __dbt__cte__int_lever__posting_tags as (


with posting_tag as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__posting_tag"
),

agg_tags as (

    select
        source_relation,
        posting_id,
        
    string_agg(tag_name, ', ')

 as tags 

    from posting_tag
    group by 1,2
)

select * from agg_tags
),  __dbt__cte__int_lever__posting_applications as (
with application as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__application"
),

agg_applications as (

    select 
        source_relation,
        posting_id,
        min(created_at) as first_app_sent_at,

        -- these should be the only types of applications
        sum(case when type = 'referral' then 1 else 0 end) as count_referred_applications,
        sum(case when type = 'posting' or type = 'agency' then 1 else 0 end) as count_posting_applications,
        sum(case when type = 'user' then 1 else 0 end) as count_manual_user_applications,

        count(distinct opportunity_id) as count_opportunities,
        count(distinct case when archived_at is null then opportunity_id end) as count_open_opportunities

    from application

    group by 1,2
),

order_hiring_managers as (

    select 
        source_relation,
        posting_id,
        posting_hiring_manager_user_id,
        row_number() over(
            partition by posting_id  
            order by created_at desc) as row_num 
    from application
),

last_hiring_manager as (

    select *
    from order_hiring_managers 
    where row_num = 1
),

final as (

    select 
        agg_applications.*,
        last_hiring_manager.posting_hiring_manager_user_id

    from agg_applications
    join last_hiring_manager
        on agg_applications.posting_id = last_hiring_manager.posting_id
        and agg_applications.source_relation = last_hiring_manager.source_relation
)

select * from final
),  __dbt__cte__int_lever__posting_interviews as (
with posting_interview as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__posting_interview"

),

interview as (

    select 
        source_relation,
        interview_id,
        opportunity_id 

    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__interview"

),

posting_interview_metrics as (
    
    select
        posting_interview.source_relation,
        posting_interview.posting_id,
        count(distinct posting_interview.interview_id) as count_interviews,
        count(distinct interview.opportunity_id) as count_interviewees

    from posting_interview 
    join interview 
        on posting_interview.interview_id = interview.interview_id
        and posting_interview.source_relation = interview.source_relation
    group by 1,2

)

select * from posting_interview_metrics
), posting as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__posting"
),


posting_tags as (

    select *
    from __dbt__cte__int_lever__posting_tags
),


posting_applications as (

    select *
    from __dbt__cte__int_lever__posting_applications
),

posting_interviews as (

    select *
    from __dbt__cte__int_lever__posting_interviews
),


posting_requisitions as (

    select
        source_relation,
        posting_id,
        count(requisition_id) as count_requisitions
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__requisition_posting"

    group by 1,2
),


lever_user as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__user"
),

final as (

    select 
        posting.*,
        posting_applications.first_app_sent_at,

        coalesce(posting_applications.count_referred_applications, 0) as count_referred_applications,
        coalesce(posting_applications.count_posting_applications, 0) as count_posting_applications,
        coalesce(posting_applications.count_manual_user_applications, 0) as count_manual_user_applications,
        coalesce(posting_applications.count_opportunities, 0) as count_opportunities,
        coalesce(posting_applications.count_open_opportunities, 0) as count_open_opportunities,

        coalesce(posting_interviews.count_interviews, 0) as count_interviews,
        coalesce(posting_interviews.count_interviewees, 0) as count_interviewees,

        
        coalesce(posting_requisitions.count_requisitions, 0) as count_requisitions,
        posting_requisitions.posting_id is not null as has_requisition,
        

        
        posting_tags.tags,
        

        lever_user.full_name as posting_hiring_manager_name

    from posting

    left join posting_applications
        on posting.posting_id = posting_applications.posting_id
        and posting.source_relation = posting_applications.source_relation
    left join posting_interviews
        on posting.posting_id = posting_interviews.posting_id
        and posting.source_relation = posting_interviews.source_relation

    
    left join posting_requisitions
        on posting.posting_id = posting_requisitions.posting_id
        and posting.source_relation = posting_requisitions.source_relation
    

    
    left join posting_tags
        on posting.posting_id = posting_tags.posting_id
        and posting.source_relation = posting_tags.source_relation
    

    left join lever_user 
        on posting_applications.posting_hiring_manager_user_id = lever_user.user_id
        and posting_applications.source_relation = lever_user.source_relation
)

select * from final

model.lever.lever__opportunity_stage_his.description: Table capturing each stage that an opportunity has advanced too.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the source of the record when unioning functionality is applied. This field will be empty if unioning is not used.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the OPPORTUNITY.

valid_from.name: valid_from
valid_from.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was changed to this stage.

stage_id.name: stage_id
stage_id.description: Foreign key referencing the STAGE that the opportunity was changed to.

stage_index_in_pipeline.name: stage_index_in_pipeline
stage_index_in_pipeline.description: The index of the stage in the pipeline at the time the stage change occurred.

valid_ending_at.name: valid_ending_at
valid_ending_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity left this stage (either by advancing or being archived).

updater_user_name.name: updater_user_name
updater_user_name.description: Full name of the user who updated the candidate to this stage.

archive_reason.name: archive_reason
archive_reason.description: Reason that the opportunity was ultimately archived.

job_title.name: job_title
job_title.description: Title of the job posting role.Title of the job posting role.

job_department.name: job_department
job_department.description: Tag for the department to which the job posting's team belongs, if present.

job_team.name: job_team
job_team.description: Tag for the team to which the job posting belongs (a sub-category of department).

application_type.name: application_type
application_type.description: Type of the application. An application can be of type referral, user, or posting. Applications of type  referral are created when a user refers a candidate for a job posting. Applications have type user when they  are applied manually to a posting in Lever. Applications have type posting when a candidate applies to a job  posting through your company's jobs page.

application_sources.name: application_sources
application_sources.description: Aggregated list of the channels through which this opportunity was sourced.

hiring_manager_name.name: hiring_manager_name
hiring_manager_name.description: Full name of the hiring manager of role for which the opportunity applied.

opportunity_owner_name.name: opportunity_owner_name
opportunity_owner_name.description: Full name of the user who owns the opportunity in Lever.

days_in_stage.name: days_in_stage
days_in_stage.description: The number of calendar days in which the opportunity has remained in this stage (ie until they advanced or were archived).

model.lever.lever__opportunity_stage_his.raw_code:
with opportunity as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('lever__opportunity_enhanced') }}
),

stage as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__stage') }}
),

lever_user as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__user') }}
),

opp_stage_history as (

    select
        source_relation,
        opportunity_id,
        updated_at as valid_from,
        stage_id,
        updater_user_id,
        to_stage_index as stage_index_in_pipeline,
        lead(updated_at) over (
            partition by opportunity_id {{', source_relation' if var('lever_union_schemas', false) or var('lever_union_databases', false) }} 
            order by updated_at asc) as valid_ending_at

    from {{ ref('stg_lever__opportunity_stage_history') }}
),

-- joining first to get opportunity.archived_at for the valid_ending_at column
join_opportunity_stage_history as (

    select 
        opp_stage_history.source_relation,
        opp_stage_history.opportunity_id,
        opportunity.contact_name as opportunity_contact_name,
        opp_stage_history.valid_from,
        coalesce(opp_stage_history.valid_ending_at, opportunity.archived_at, {{ dbt.current_timestamp_backcompat() }}) as valid_ending_at,
        stage.stage_name as stage,

        opp_stage_history.stage_id,
        opp_stage_history.stage_index_in_pipeline,

        lever_user.full_name as updater_user_name,
        opportunity.archive_reason, -- if archived later
        opportunity.job_title,
        opportunity.job_department,
        opportunity.job_location,
        opportunity.job_team,
        opportunity.application_type,
        opportunity.sources as application_sources,
        opportunity.hiring_manager_name,
        opportunity.opportunity_owner_name

    from opp_stage_history

    join stage
        on opp_stage_history.stage_id = stage.stage_id
        and opp_stage_history.source_relation = stage.source_relation
    left join lever_user
        on lever_user.user_id = opp_stage_history.updater_user_id 
        and lever_user.source_relation = opp_stage_history.source_relation
    join opportunity
        on opportunity.opportunity_id = opp_stage_history.opportunity_id
        and opportunity.source_relation = opp_stage_history.source_relation
),

final_time_in_stages as (

    select
       *,
        {{ dbt.datediff('valid_from', 'valid_ending_at', 'day') }} as days_in_stage
        
    from join_opportunity_stage_history

)

select * from final_time_in_stages

with opportunity as (

),

),

opp_stage_history as (

    select
        source_relation,
        opportunity_id,
        updated_at as valid_from,
        stage_id,
        updater_user_id,
        to_stage_index as stage_index_in_pipeline,

            partition by opportunity_id  
            order by updated_at asc) as valid_ending_at

    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__opportunity_stage_history"
),

-- joining first to get opportunity.archived_at for the valid_ending_at column
join_opportunity_stage_history as (

    select 
        opp_stage_history.source_relation,
        opp_stage_history.opportunity_id,
        opportunity.contact_name as opportunity_contact_name,
        opp_stage_history.valid_from,
        coalesce(opp_stage_history.valid_ending_at, opportunity.archived_at, 
    current_timestamp::timestamp
) as valid_ending_at,
        stage.stage_name as stage,

        opp_stage_history.stage_id,
        opp_stage_history.stage_index_in_pipeline,

        lever_user.full_name as updater_user_name,
        opportunity.archive_reason, -- if archived later
        opportunity.job_title,

        opportunity.job_location,

    join opportunity
        on opportunity.opportunity_id = opp_stage_history.opportunity_id

final_time_in_stages as (

archived_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was archived.

archived_reason_id.name: archived_reason_id
archived_reason_id.description: Foreign key referencing the ARCHIVE_REASON for which the opportunity was archived.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.description: Foreign key referencing the CONTACT info of the candidate applying in this opportunity.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was created (ie when the candidate clicked "apply" on your company website).

is_data_protection_contact_allowed.name: is_data_protection_contact_allowed
is_data_protection_contact_allowed.description: Boolean that is true if relevant data policy regulations allow for contacting  this opportunity's candidate.

data_protection_contact_expires_at.name: data_protection_contact_expires_at
data_protection_contact_expires_at.description: Timestamp of when this permission/data policy expires.

is_data_protection_store_allowed.name: is_data_protection_store_allowed
is_data_protection_store_allowed.description: Boolean that is true if relevant data policy regulations allow for storing  this opportunity record.

data_protection_store_expires_at.name: data_protection_store_expires_at
data_protection_store_expires_at.description: Timestamp of when this permission/data policy expires.

contact_headline.name: contact_headline

is_anonymized.name: is_anonymized
is_anonymized.description: Boolean that is true if the opportunity has been anonymized (therefore fully anonymizing  the contact and removing their *personal* information).

last_advanced_at.name: last_advanced_at
last_advanced_at.description: Timestamp of when the candidate advanced to their current stage in the hiring pipeline.

last_interaction_at.name: last_interaction_at
last_interaction_at.description: Timestamp of when the Opportunity profile was last interacted with. See interactions [here](https://help.lever.co/hc/en-us/articles/205697619).

contact_location.name: contact_location
contact_location.description: Current contact location of the candidate.

origin.name: origin

owner_user_id.name: owner_user_id

snoozed_until.name: snoozed_until

stage_id.name: stage_id

updated_at.name: updated_at
updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was last updated in lever.

comments.name: comments
comments.description: Any additional comments from the candidate included in the job application.

company.name: company

posting_hiring_manager_user_id.name: posting_hiring_manager_user_id
posting_hiring_manager_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who is the job posting's hiring manager, at the time  the application was submitted.

posting_id.name: posting_id

Applications have type posting when a candidate applies to a job  posting through your company's jobs page.

hiring_manager_name.name: hiring_manager_name
hiring_manager_name.description: Full name of the hiring manager of role for which the opportunity applied.

sources.name: sources
sources.description: Aggregated list of the channels through which this opportunity was sourced.

emails.name: emails
emails.description: Aggregated list of email addresses associated with this contact.

linkedin_link.description: Contact URL that contains 'linkedin.com' in it.

github_link.description: Contact URL that contains 'github.com' in it.

model.lever.int_lever__opportunity_conta.raw_code:
with opportunity as (

    -- this builds off the source opportunity table, incorporating application and internal user data. 
    select *
    from {{ ref('int_lever__opportunity_users') }}
),

opportunity_sources as (

    select
        source_relation,
        opportunity_id,
        {{ fivetran_utils.string_agg('source', "', '") }} as sources

    from {{ ref('stg_lever__opportunity_source') }}

    group by 1,2
),

contact_info as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('int_lever__contact_info') }}
),

order_resumes as (

    select 
        *,
        row_number() over(
            partition by opportunity_id {{', source_relation' if var('lever_union_schemas', false) or var('lever_union_databases', false) }} 
            order by created_at desc) as row_num
    
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__resume') }}
),

latest_resume as (

    select *
    from order_resumes 

    where row_num = 1
),

final as (

    select
        opportunity.*,
        opportunity_sources.sources,
        latest_resume.file_download_url as resume_download_url,

model.lever.int_lever__opportunity_users.name: int_lever__opportunity_users
model.lever.int_lever__opportunity_users.description: Table relating opportunities to all of its stakeholders.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the source of the record when unioning functionality is applied. This field will be empty if unioning is not used.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Unique ID of the opportunity.

archived_at.name: archived_at
archived_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was archived.

archived_reason_id.name: archived_reason_id
archived_reason_id.description: Foreign key referencing the ARCHIVE_REASON for which the opportunity was archived.

contact_id.name: contact_id
contact_id.description: Foreign key referencing the CONTACT info of the candidate applying in this opportunity.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was created (ie when the candidate clicked "apply" on your company website).

is_data_protection_contact_allowed.name: is_data_protection_contact_allowed
is_data_protection_contact_allowed.description: Boolean that is true if relevant data policy regulations allow for contacting  this opportunity's candidate.

data_protection_contact_expires_at.name: data_protection_contact_expires_at
data_protection_contact_expires_at.description: Timestamp of when this permission/data policy expires.

is_data_protection_store_allowed.name: is_data_protection_store_allowed
is_data_protection_store_allowed.description: Boolean that is true if relevant data policy regulations allow for storing  this opportunity record.

data_protection_store_expires_at.name: data_protection_store_expires_at
data_protection_store_expires_at.description: Timestamp of when this permission/data policy expires.

contact_headline.name: contact_headline
contact_headline.description: Contact headline, typically a list of previous companies where the contact has worked or  schools that the contact has attended.

is_anonymized.name: is_anonymized
is_anonymized.description: Boolean that is true if the opportunity has been anonymized (therefore fully anonymizing  the contact and removing their *personal* information).

last_advanced_at.name: last_advanced_at
last_advanced_at.description: Timestamp of when the candidate advanced to their current stage in the hiring pipeline.

last_interaction_at.name: last_interaction_at
last_interaction_at.description: Timestamp of when the Opportunity profile was last interacted with. See interactions [here](https://help.lever.co/hc/en-us/articles/205697619).

contact_location.name: contact_location
contact_location.description: Current contact location of the candidate.

origin.name: origin
origin.description: The way in which the opportunity was added to lever. Includes 'agency', 'applied', 'internal', 'referred', 'sourced', and 'university'.

owner_user_id.name: owner_user_id
owner_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who owns this opportunity.

snoozed_until.name: snoozed_until
snoozed_until.description: Timestamp of when the current snooze period of this opportunity ends (if snoozed).

stage_id.name: stage_id
stage_id.description: Foreign key referencing the ID of the current stage of the opportunity.

updated_at.name: updated_at
updated_at.description: Timestamp of when the opportunity was last updated in lever.

comments.name: comments
comments.description: Any additional comments from the candidate included in the job application.

company.name: company
company.description: The candidate's current company or organization.

posting_hiring_manager_user_id.name: posting_hiring_manager_user_id
posting_hiring_manager_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who is the job posting's hiring manager, at the time  the application was submitted.

posting_id.name: posting_id
posting_id.description: Foreign key referencing the job POSTING for which the candidate applied.

posting_owner_user_id.name: posting_owner_user_id
posting_owner_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the USER who owns this posting at the time the candidate applied.

referrer_user_id.name: referrer_user_id
referrer_user_id.description: The user ID of the candidate's referrer.

requisition_id.name: requisition_id
requisition_id.description: If the application was archived as hired against a requisition, a foreign key referencing the id of the REQUISITION against which the application was hired.

application_type.name: application_type
application_type.description: Type of the application. An application can be of type referral, user, or posting. Applications of type  referral are created when a user refers a candidate for a job posting. Applications have type user when they  are applied manually to a posting in Lever. Applications have type posting when a candidate applies to a job  posting through your company's jobs page.

opportunity_owner_name.name: opportunity_owner_name
opportunity_owner_name.description: Full name of the user who owns the opportunity in Lever.

referrer_name.name: referrer_name
referrer_name.description: Full name of the user who referred the candidate for this opportunity.

hiring_manager_name.name: hiring_manager_name
hiring_manager_name.description: Full name of the hiring manager of role for which the opportunity applied.

model.lever.int_lever__interview_users.name: int_lever__interview_users
model.lever.int_lever__interview_users.description: Table relating internal-user information (ie names and emails) with interviews they are somehow involved in.

canceled_at.name: canceled_at
canceled_at.description: Timestamp of when the interview was canceled.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the interview was created.

creator_user_id.name: creator_user_id
creator_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who created the interview in lever.

occurred_at.name: occurred_at
occurred_at.description: Date + time at which the interview was set to occur.

duration_minutes.name: duration_minutes
duration_minutes.description: Interview duration in minutes, minimum value is 1.

feedback_reminder_frequency.name: feedback_reminder_frequency
feedback_reminder_frequency.description: Frequency of feedback reminders (i.e. once, daily, frequently, none). Defaults to 'frequently' which is every 6 hours.

location.name: location
location.description: Interview location. Usually the name of a booked conference room but can also be a  phone number to call.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Foreign key referencing the OPPORTUNITY being interviewed for.

panel_id.name: panel_id
panel_id.description: Unique id of the PANEL this interview belongs to.

opportunity_stage_id.name: opportunity_stage_id
opportunity_stage_id.description: Foreign key referencing the STAGE that the candidate was in at the time  the interview was scheduled.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.description: Name of timezone in which interview was scheduled to occur.

feedback_form_id.name: feedback_form_id
feedback_form_id.description: Unique id of the feedback form.

feedback_completer_user_id.name: feedback_completer_user_id
feedback_completer_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who completed the feedback.

feedback_completed_at.name: feedback_completed_at
feedback_completed_at.description: Timestamp of when the feedback form was completed.

feedback_form_instructions.name: feedback_form_instructions
feedback_form_instructions.description: Guidelines given for how give a feedback score.

score_system_value.name: score_system_value
score_system_value.description: Overall rating (1-4 scale) to the candidate.

feedback_form_title.name: feedback_form_title
feedback_form_title.description: Form title. This can be edited in Feedback and Form Settings.

interviewer_user_id.name: interviewer_user_id
interviewer_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER that interviewed the candidate.

feedback_completer_name.name: feedback_completer_name
feedback_completer_name.description: Full name of the user who completed the feedback form.

interview_coordinator_name.name: interview_coordinator_name
interview_coordinator_name.description: Full name of the user who created the interviewer in Lever.

model.lever.int_lever__interview_users.raw_code:
with interview_feedback as (
    select *
    from {{ ref('int_lever__interview_feedback') }}
),

lever_user as (
    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__user') }}
),

interviewer_user as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__interviewer_user') }}
),

-- there can be multiple interviewers for one interview
grab_interviewers as (

    select
        interview_feedback.*,
        interviewer_user.user_id as interviewer_user_id
    from interview_feedback
    left join interviewer_user 
        on interview_feedback.interview_id = interviewer_user.interview_id
        and interview_feedback.feedback_completer_user_id = interviewer_user.user_id
        and interview_feedback.source_relation = interviewer_user.source_relation

),

-- necessary users are 
-- interviewer, completer of feedback, recruiter coordinator , hiring manager
grab_user_names as (

    select
        grab_interviewers.*,
        interviewer.full_name as inteviewer_name,
        interviewer.email as interviewer_email,
        feedback_completer.full_name as feedback_completer_name,
        interview_coordinator.full_name as interview_coordinator_name

    from 
    grab_interviewers
    left join lever_user as interviewer 
        on grab_interviewers.interviewer_user_id = interviewer.user_id
        and interviewer.source_relation = grab_interviewers.source_relation

    left join lever_user as feedback_completer
        on grab_interviewers.feedback_completer_user_id = feedback_completer.user_id
        and feedback_completer.source_relation = grab_interviewers.source_relation

    left join lever_user as interview_coordinator
        on grab_interviewers.creator_user_id = interview_coordinator.user_id
        and interview_coordinator.source_relation = grab_interviewers.source_relation

)

-- unique row for every interview-interviewer-feedback combo
select * from grab_user_names

with  __dbt__cte__int_lever__interview_feedback as (
with interview as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__interview"

),

-- join with this to limit noise 
interview_feedback as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__interview_feedback"
),

feedback_form as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__feedback_form"

    where deleted_at is null
),

join_w_feedback as (

    select
        interview.*,
        feedback_form.feedback_form_id,
        feedback_form.creator_user_id as feedback_completer_user_id,
        feedback_form.completed_at as feedback_completed_at,

        feedback_form.instructions as feedback_form_instructions,
        feedback_form.score_system_value,
        feedback_form.form_title as feedback_form_title


    from interview
    left join interview_feedback 
        on interview.interview_id = interview_feedback.interview_id
        and interview.source_relation = interview_feedback.source_relation
    left join feedback_form 
        on interview_feedback.feedback_form_id = feedback_form.feedback_form_id
        and interview_feedback.source_relation = feedback_form.source_relation
)

from join_w_feedback

__dbt__cte__int_lever__interview_feedback as (
with interview as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__interview"

),

-- join with this to limit noise 
interview_feedback as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__interview_feedback"
),

feedback_form as (

    select *
    from "postgres"."public_lever_dev"."stg_lever__feedback_form"

    where deleted_at is null
),

join_w_feedback as (

    select
        interview.*,
        feedback_form.feedback_form_id,
        feedback_form.creator_user_id as feedback_completer_user_id,
        feedback_form.completed_at as feedback_completed_at,

        feedback_form.instructions as feedback_form_instructions,
        feedback_form.score_system_value,
        feedback_form.form_title as feedback_form_title


    from interview
    left join interview_feedback 
        on interview.interview_id = interview_feedback.interview_id
        and interview.source_relation = interview_feedback.source_relation
    left join feedback_form 
        on interview_feedback.feedback_form_id = feedback_form.feedback_form_id
        and interview_feedback.source_relation = feedback_form.source_relation
)

select *
from join_w_feedback
)

model.lever.int_lever__interview_feedbac.name: int_lever__interview_feedback
model.lever.int_lever__interview_feedbac.description: Table associating interviews with feedback given by individual interviewers. A single interview might have submit multiple feedback forms.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the source of the record when unioning functionality is applied. This field will be empty if unioning is not used.

canceled_at.name: canceled_at
canceled_at.description: Timestamp of when the interview was canceled.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the interview was created.

creator_user_id.name: creator_user_id
creator_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who created the interview in lever.

occurred_at.name: occurred_at
occurred_at.description: Date + time at which the interview was set to occur.

duration_minutes.name: duration_minutes
duration_minutes.description: Interview duration in minutes, minimum value is 1.

feedback_reminder_frequency.name: feedback_reminder_frequency
feedback_reminder_frequency.description: Frequency of feedback reminders (i.e. once, daily, frequently, none). Defaults to 'frequently' which is every 6 hours.

location.name: location
location.description: Interview location. Usually the name of a booked conference room but can also be a  phone number to call.

opportunity_id.name: opportunity_id
opportunity_id.description: Foreign key referencing the OPPORTUNITY being interviewed for.

panel_id.name: panel_id
panel_id.description: Unique id of the PANEL this interview belongs to.

opportunity_stage_id.name: opportunity_stage_id
opportunity_stage_id.description: Foreign key referencing the STAGE that the candidate was in at the time  the interview was scheduled.

timezone.name: timezone
timezone.description: Name of timezone in which interview was scheduled to occur.

feedback_form_id.name: feedback_form_id
feedback_form_id.description: Unique id of the feedback form.

feedback_completer_user_id.name: feedback_completer_user_id
feedback_completer_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who completed the feedback.

feedback_completed_at.name: feedback_completed_at
feedback_completed_at.description: Timestamp of when the feedback form was completed.

feedback_form_instructions.name: feedback_form_instructions
feedback_form_instructions.description: Guidelines given for how give a feedback score.

score_system_value.name: score_system_value
score_system_value.description: Overall rating (1-4 scale) to the candidate.

feedback_form_title.name: feedback_form_title
feedback_form_title.description: Form title. This can be edited in Feedback and Form Settings.

source_relation.description: Indicates the source of the record when unioning functionality is applied. This field will be empty if unioning is not used.

posting_id.name: posting_id
posting_id.description: Foreign key referencing the id of the job POSTING.

model.lever.int_lever__posting_interview.raw_code:
with posting_interview as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__posting_interview') }}

),

interview as (

    select 
        source_relation,
        interview_id,
        opportunity_id 

    from {{ ref('stg_lever__interview') }}

),

posting_interview_metrics as (
    
    select
        posting_interview.source_relation,
        posting_interview.posting_id,
        count(distinct posting_interview.interview_id) as count_interviews,
        count(distinct interview.opportunity_id) as count_interviewees

    from posting_interview 
    join interview 
        on posting_interview.interview_id = interview.interview_id
        and posting_interview.source_relation = interview.source_relation
    group by 1,2

)

select * from posting_interview_metrics

model.lever.int_lever__requisition_users.description: Table relating requisitions to its stakeholders.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the source of the record when unioning functionality is applied. This field will be empty if unioning is not used.

is_backfill.name: is_backfill
is_backfill.description: Boolean that is true if the requisition represents a backfill or new headcount.  If unspecified, defaults to false.

compensation_band_currency.name: compensation_band_currency
compensation_band_currency.description: The ISO currency code associated with the requisition's compensation band.

compensation_band_interval.name: compensation_band_interval
compensation_band_interval.description: The string representing the interval of payment for the compensation band.

compensation_band_max.name: compensation_band_max
compensation_band_max.description: The high bound for the compensation band.

compensation_band_min.name: compensation_band_min
compensation_band_min.description: The low bound for the compensation band.

created_at.name: created_at
created_at.description: Timestamp of when the requisition was first created.

creator_user_id.name: creator_user_id
creator_user_id.description: Foreign key referencing the USER who created the requisition.

employment_status.name: employment_status
employment_status.description: The work type of the requisition ('full-time', 'part-time', 'intern', 'contractor', or 'temp-worker').

headcount_hired.name: headcount_hired
headcount_hired.description: The number of filled seats / openings on the requisition, or the string, 'unlimited'.

headcount_total_allotted.name: headcount_total_allotted
headcount_total_allotted.description: Total headcount allotted for this requisition.

hiring_manager_user_id.name: hiring_manager_user_id

job_team.name: job_team
job_team.description: The team associated with the requisition

creator_name.name: creator_name
creator_name.description: Full name of the user who created the requisition.

requisition_owner_name.name: requisition_owner_name
requisition_owner_name.description: Full user name of the user who owns the requisition.

hiring_manager_name.name: hiring_manager_name

model.lever.int_lever__requisition_users.raw_code:
{{ config(enabled=var('lever_using_requisitions', True)) }}

with lever_user as (

    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__user') }}
),

requisition as (
    
    select *
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__requisition') }}
),

-- necessary users = req owner, creator, hiring manager
grab_user_names as (

    select
        requisition.*,
        creator.full_name as creator_name,
        requisition_owner.full_name as requisition_owner_name,
        hiring_manager.full_name as hiring_manager_name

    from requisition

    left join lever_user as creator
        on requisition.creator_user_id = creator.user_id
        and creator.source_relation = requisition.source_relation

    left join lever_user as hiring_manager
        on requisition.hiring_manager_user_id = hiring_manager.user_id
        and hiring_manager.source_relation = requisition.source_relation

    
    left join lever_user as requisition_owner
        on requisition.owner_user_id = requisition_owner.user_id
        and requisition_owner.source_relation = requisition.source_relation

)

select * from grab_user_names

model.lever.int_lever__contact_info.name: int_lever__contact_info
model.lever.int_lever__contact_info.description: Table that the most relevant contact info associated with each contact.

source_relation.name: source_relation
source_relation.description: Indicates the source of the record when unioning functionality is applied. This field will be empty if unioning is not used.

emails.name: emails
emails.description: Aggregated list of email addresses associated with this contact.

phones.name: phones
phones.description: Aggregated list of the contact's phone numbers (with phone types).

linkedin_link.name: linkedin_link
linkedin_link.description: Contact URL that contains 'linkedin.com' in it.

github_link.name: github_link
github_link.description: Contact URL that contains 'github.com' in it.

model.lever.int_lever__contact_info.raw_code:
with contact_phones as (

    select
        source_relation,
        contact_id,
        {{ fivetran_utils.string_agg("phone_type || ': ' || phone_number" , "', '") }} as phones

    from {{ ref('stg_lever__contact_phone') }}

    group by 1,2
),

contact_emails as (

    select
        source_relation,
        contact_id,
        {{ fivetran_utils.string_agg("'<' || email || '>'" , "', '") }} as emails

    from {{ ref('stg_lever__contact_email') }}

    group by 1,2
),

contact_links as (

    select 
        source_relation,
        contact_id,

        -- ideally, people only have one of each type of these links. 
        -- taking the max as that will produce a more constant result than ordering via row_number() window
        -- function ordering by _fivetran_synced

        max(case when lower(link) like '%linkedin.com%' then link end) as linkedin_link,
        max(case when lower(link) like '%github.com%' then link end) as github_link
    
    from {{ ref('stg_lever__contact_link') }}
    group by 1,2
),

final as (

    select 
        contact_emails.*,
        contact_phones.phones,
        contact_links.linkedin_link,
        contact_links.github_link

    from contact_emails 
    left join contact_phones 
        on contact_emails.contact_id = contact_phones.contact_id
        and contact_emails.source_relation = contact_phones.source_relation
    left join contact_links 
        on contact_emails.contact_id = contact_links.contact_id
        and contact_emails.source_relation = contact_links.source_relation
)

select * from final
